hero.title: Di Zhu

hero.description:
Assistant Professor of Geographic Information Science
University of Minnesota, Twin Cities

about.title: About Me
content: I am an Assistant Professor of Geographic Information Science (GIScience) in the Department of Geography, Environment and Society (GES), University of Minnesota, Twin Cities (UMN), and the director of Geospatial Data Intelligence (GeoDI) Lab.
My research focuses on GIScience, Geospatial Artificial Intelligence (GeoAI), Spatial Networks, Human-Environment Interactions, and Urban Complexities.

affiliations.title: Executive Committee Member
affiliations.organization: Master of GIS program at UMN

affiliations.title: Board Member
affiliations.organization: International Association of Chinese Professionals in Geographic Information Sciences (CPGIS)

areas.title: Geospatial AI
areas.description: Exploring intelligent spatial prediction and modeling using deep learning and machine learning approaches.

areas.title: Spatial Networks
areas.description: Analyzing complex spatial interaction patterns and network structures in urban environments.

areas.title: Human-Environment Interactions
areas.description: Understanding the dynamic relationships between human activities and environmental changes.

areas.title: Urban Complexities
areas.description: Investigating urban systems through spatial analytics and computational methods.

lab.title: Geospatial Data Intelligence (GeoDI) Lab
lab.description: Discovering intelligent, innovative, and informative spatio-temporal insights from big geo-data — bridging GIScience, Geospatial AI, and Social Sensing at interdisciplinary frontiers.

focus_areas.title: Intelligent Social Sensing
focus_areas.description: Understanding human-environment interactions through big geo-data and spatial analytics.

focus_areas.title: Geospatial Intelligence
focus_areas.description: Advancing spatial analytics and modeling with machine learning and deep learning principles.

lab.location: 473 Social Sciences Building, 267 19th Ave S, Minneapolis, MN 55455

recruitment.title: Join GeoDI Lab
recruitment.description: We are seeking PhD/MA students to join us in the Twin Cities. Please feel free to reach out with your CV, transcript, and one writing sample.
recruitment.note: Inquiries without transcript and writing sample(s) would not be considered.
